snippet: Twenty-five California legislators called on Gov. George W. Bush of Texas today to run for President, saying his education policies and ''compassionate conservatism'' made him the strongest candidate in a growing Republican field.    The petition ...
lead_paragraph: Twenty-five California legislators called on Gov. George W. Bush of Texas today to run for President, saying his education policies and ''compassionate conservatism'' made him the strongest candidate in a growing Republican field. The petition was signed by 22 of 32 Republicans in the state Assembly and 3 of 15 Republican state senators. They represent moderates and conservatives, and included all four Hispanic Republicans.
abstract: Twenty-five moderate and conservative California legislators call on Texas Gov George W Bush to run for President, citing him as strongest candidate in growing Republican field; petition is slap at former Gov Pete Wilson, who weighs race (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; 25 California Legislators Endorse Texas Governor
